Key Match Events: South Africa beat England by seven runs in the T20 World Cup on June 21, 2024.
Quinton de Kock scored 65 runs off 38 balls and was named Man of the Match.
South Africa's fielding was superb, with a key catch by Markram to dismiss Brook.
Jansen and Rabada bowled crucial 18th and 19th overs to pull the game back for South Africa.
Post-Match Reflections: Markram commented on the team's performance, stating they are on the right track despite not playing a complete game.
Buttler credited de Kock as the game changer and praised Brook and Livingstone's partnership.
De Kock reflected on the pitch conditions and praised the team's bowling performance in the powerplay.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa maintained their unbeaten record in the tournament.
The match was held at Daren Sammy National Cricket Stadium, Gros Islet.
